page.title: 15Nature South of Oakley 2
page.content: While{trees}and{hedgerows}are still a feature of the area, parts of South Wood have been felled to form extra fields as has the oak tree to the east of{Oakley Park.}Most of{Pardown Copse} was cleared to discourage poachers. Some trees marking parish boundaries have gone including the elms in Oakley Park killed by{Dutch Elm Disease.} However, to the north of this site is an old chalk pit where two large beech trees grow estimated to be over 100 years old. North-west of{Oakdown Farm} alongside the A30 and forming part of the parish boundary, is an ancient hedgerow. Along 30 yards of the north- ern edge, a species count showed this hedge to be probably over 1000 years old and therefore of Anglo-Saxon origin.{Common trees}in the area include oak, beech, ash, silver birch, larch, sycamore, hawthorn and hazel.
